alert.note: Alert for Cocke Smoky Mountains; Northwest Greene; Southeast Greene (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 7:19PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL COCKE AND SOUTHEASTERN GREENE COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 818 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hot Springs, or 15 miles east of Newport. This storm was moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Greeneville, Camp Creek, and Cedar Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cocke Smoky Mountains; Northwest Greene; Southeast Greene
